Comment: *Sorry, my comment was not clear at all. I wasn't implying at that you don't know what an EO means. I was actually trying to support and reassure you, but failed completely.  Let me try that again:*  According to the immunity ruling, TRUMP may be allowed to *issue* an illegal order and not be arrested for it. But no one under him is absolved of anything if they choose to follow it.  His EO doesn't change the law for anyone else, which is what I meant this first time when I said it doesn't change anything.   For example, a DOGE employee acting on an EO can't physically assault an employee who won't leave a federal building. That DOGE employee can definitely be arrested. If the courts later decide the EO itself was illegal, Trump can't be arrested for issuing it (that's what the immunity ruling meant). The DOGE employees can't be arrested for acting on it *if they believed it to be legal.*. But they CAN be arrested for breaking laws in the process.   That's a black and white example, but the premise stands across a lot of the things executive branch employees are doing. They are illegal and the employees can and hopefully WILL be held accountable eventually. My hope is that if a few people suffer the consequences of acting illegally in furtherance of Trump's agenda, others won't be so quick to act. But that can't happen until the people with the authority to hold them accountable stop being pussies.

Comment: I think it is amazing that no one comments on the sheer number of executive orders the Orange Turd has written. No president has ever written 150 EOs in their first 100 days. Trump’s EOs literally tell the executive branch to ignore the Constitution, ignore the Law and ignore court orders. Basically, federal agencies are TOLD to break the law.  Why is this happening? The Supreme Court ruled last year that a president cannot be charged with breaking the law if he is performing an official act.  In this situation, the word “act” an official function. Writing EOs is an official act/function of the president. So, he can’t be charged with breaking the law!! What about the agency heads who implement Trump’s flaunting of the law? They’re protected because Trump will instruct the Justice Department to not investigate these individuals illegal act. Basically, the Executive branch is free to do whatever Trump tells them to do!!!
